S.FORM: == badisusu' == 葡萄 calaycay ku heci nu badisusu' ni Namuh. asu' ku heci nu badisusu'. siwkay nu badisusu' badisusu' u nipaluma nu kakaenen. u mapelu' ku papah a kilang-masay a nipaluma. yadah ku heci, asu' mukan tu heci nu badisusu'. naayaw a badisusu' cilemin, ayzaay a badisusu' nupaluma'an nu malukay, sicedam tu. uzumaay a sasahicaan sa u taneng palidung. kya masay mukacaw tu cuket tayza takalaway, sisa silidung tu. ayzasa mananam tu ku Sakizaya a tademaw musakamu tu "putau" satu, u Hulam a kamu kuyza. na u tademaw paluma' tu badisusu' i ayaw 6000-8000 a mihcan, i Capi-wali subal . tinaku a kamu badisusu'葡萄 / calaycay ku heci nu badisusu' ni Namuh. asu' ku heci nu badisusu'. mibadisusu'採葡萄 / mibadisusu' kaku tu pituway a bulad nu mihecaan. mibadisusu'ay採葡萄的 / awawan naku ku mibadisusu'ay a mibadisusu' tu nu maku. pibadisusu'i去採葡萄 / pibadisusu'i kisu Bunuk aci Sayun! sibadisusu'有葡萄；有種葡萄 / sibadisusu' ci Benel i buyu'. sibadisusu'ay / sibadisusu'ay ku kakitaan nu Sakul. u sulit nu Hulam atu Amilika . This article is about the fruits of the genus Vitis. For the European grapevine, see Vitis vinifera. For other uses, see Grape (disambiguation). A grape is a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis. Grapes can be eaten fresh as table grapes or they can be used for making wine, jam, juice, jelly, grape seed extract, raisins, vinegar, and grape seed oil. Grapes are a non-climacteric type of fruit, generally occurring in clusters.

== badisoso' == 葡萄 calaycay ko heci no badisoso' ni Namoh. aso' ko heci no badisoso'. siwkay no badisoso' badisoso' o nipaloma no kakaenen. o mapelo' ko papah a kilang-masay a nipaloma. yadah ko heci, aso' mokan to heci no badisoso'. naayaw a badisoso' cilemin, ayzaay a badisoso' nopaloma'an no malokay, sicedam to. ozomaay a sasahicaan sa o taneng palidong. kya masay mokacaw to coket tayza takalaway, sisa silidong to. ayzasa mananam to ko Sakizaya a tademaw mosakamo to "potao" sato, o Holam a kamo koyza. na o tademaw paloma' to badisoso' i ayaw 6000-8000 a mihcan, i Capi-wali sobal . tinako a kamo badisoso'葡萄 / calaycay ko heci no badisoso' ni Namoh. aso' ko heci no badisoso'. mibadisoso'採葡萄 / mibadisoso' kako to pitoway a bolad no mihecaan. mibadisoso'ay採葡萄的 / awawan nako ko mibadisoso'ay a mibadisoso' to no mako. pibadisoso'i去採葡萄 / pibadisoso'i kiso Bonok aci Sayon! sibadisoso'有葡萄；有種葡萄 / sibadisoso' ci Benel i boyo'. sibadisoso'ay / sibadisoso'ay ko kakitaan no Sakol. o solit no Holam ato Amilika . This article is aboot the froits of the genos Vitis. For the Eoropean grapevine, see Vitis vinifera. For other oses, see Grape (disambigoation). A grape is a froit, botanically a berry, of the decidooos woody vines of the flowering plant genos Vitis. Grapes can be eaten fresh as table grapes or they can be osed for making wine, jam, joice, jelly, grape seed extract, raisins, vinegar, and grape seed oil. Grapes are a non-climacteric type of froit, generally occorring in closters.
